conclusion: Understand the flow of liquid through the baffles and how it will be directed into containers E, F, or G.
Baffle A is yellow and positioned at the top left.
Baffle B is cyan and positioned next to A.
Baffle C is blue and positioned next to B.
Baffle D is white and positioned next to C.
Baffle A is likely to redirect the flow to the right.
Baffle B is likely to redirect the flow downward.
Baffle C is likely to redirect the flow to the right.
Baffle D is likely to redirect the flow upward.
Liquid flowing through A will likely go to the right.
Liquid flowing through B will likely go downward.
Liquid flowing through C will likely go to the right.
Liquid flowing through D will likely go upward.
Liquid flowing through A and C will likely go to the right and enter container G.
Liquid flowing through B will likely go downward and enter container F.
Liquid flowing through D will likely go upward and enter container E.
Liquid from A will flow into container G.
Liquid from B will flow into container F.
Liquid from C will flow into container G.
Liquid from D will flow into container E.
